answers.answer: not to come off rude but the swelling and sore feet is most likely from the weight gain pregnancy takes a toll on the body and excess weight gain doesn't make it any better I gained quite a bit really fast when I hit my third trimester  and I was completely  uncomfortable I was having swelling my legs and feet hurt then I started to get more on track with my eating and hit the gym regularly and I dropped some excess weight off and I've never felt bettwr

Ouch..... That sounds horrible, I'm 30 weeks and have only gained 9lbs. 62lbs Definitely sounds like more weight than you should put on. If you're really concerned you can talk to another doctor.I wouldn't trust just one doctors opinion.My first doctor is an idiot.

What are u eating lol?  Make sure u don't have high blood pressure because the swelling might be a sign of preeclampsia. I'm a little swollen too but my doc said it's only cause I'm getting close to labor. I'm 36 weeks
Watch your sodium! Alot of swelling comes from too much sodium and not enough water, that's what my PA told me.

question: Am 34 weeks I have gain 62 lbs during this pregnancy am soo swollen my feet hurt soo bad but my doctor keeps telling me that everything is normal but I feel like is not.Has anyone been through the same situation??
title: Weight gain?
